author: bridge-bot
content:
<big_tech_sux> re: **@shemnon**
> So my substantial concerns are low memory usage cost and zk ergonomics, the rest of my points are style and taste (I.e. non-blocking)
Who is the best person to talk to re. zk ergonomics?

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> I'd say @kevaundray, if he doesn't know the answer he will know what telegram groups to point you to.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sophiagold0> Which EIP is this about and what are the concerns specifically?

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> Is it better for zks to allocate transient memory one byte/word at a time or 4k at a time?

author: bridge-bot
content: <sophiagold0> My intuition is it doesn’t matter. I can ask zkVM teams, but would not expect definitive answers

author: bridge-bot
content: <sophiagold0> If we’re changing the cost, is there interest in adding a limit per sub-call as in EIP-7686?

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> I'm also concerned about apps that use MSIZE to "append" - will they be doing this in 4KiB increments now?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<big_tech_sux> re: **@shemnon**
> I'm also concerned about apps that use MSIZE to "append" - will they be doing this in 4KiB increments now?
I think msize maintains the same semantics

author: bridge-bot
content: <shemnon> My reading of the EIP it isnt clear.  Soliditys starter pushing a number to zero... Is msize 32 or 4096?  In current clients that is handled just by checking the size of the vector (even if it's overallocated).  Would the whole page count or still the extent of the highest write?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<big_tech_sux> re: **@shemnon**
> My reading of the EIP it isnt clear.  Soliditys starter pushing a number to zero... Is msize 32 or 4096?  In current clients that is handled just by checking the size of the vector (even if it's overallocated).  Would the whole page count or still the extent of the highest write?
32- extent of the highest write
